data.title: Add an argument to set game folder
data.body:
I'm in the process of writing a rc.d script for FreeBSD, but I notice weird behaviors. I believe an argument explicitly setting the workdir would fix the issues I'm facing.
E.g.

```
mono --debug /home/openra/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game.exe OpenRA.Home=/home/openra
```

So that logs will go in  `/home/openra/.openra`
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/20806004-add-an-argument-to-set-game-folder?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

Added an Infiltrate function to lua
Adds checks for OpenRA.Utility.exe in make.cmd.
data.body: It displays a message now instead of file not found error. Fixes #8182.

data.title: Soviet mission 5 conversion
data.body:
Hello guys! I started with conversion of the Soviet 5th mission from the original campaign, however after recreating map and actors, I seem to be unable to do the scripting. I knew how to do it in RAED, but Lua is just too confusing for me, sorry. To complete it, I either need someone willing to do it or someone willing to answer my (probably dumb) questions. I did look at the wiki and all the tutorials, but for example I couldn't force the three guys at the start to even move. I tried to do ActorName.ScriptedMove (x,y), ActorName.ScriptedMove (waypointname.Location), and so on, but it never worked, log said he can't convert 0 to CPos. I tried to define CPos by using waypoint or raw coordinates, but in vain.

I can send you the files if you tell me where,I cut the crashing lua from it.

data.title: Make some mandatory things POSIX-compliant
data.body:
See #8405 : The scripts needed to build and run the server (dedicated) on FreeBSD have been updated to be POSIX compliant.
The rest should, too.
The makefile should be modified to allow FreeBSD (`uname -s` returns `FreeBSD`) and the fetch dependencies & configure dependencies scripts for Linux work for FreeBSD too, now that they are POSIX.

data.title: POSIX compliance
data.body: I want to run a dedicated on FreeBSD, hence the 3 issues and this PR

data.title: Make requires GNU make
data.body:
I required GNU make to build openra

```
$ make
make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 79: Missing dependency operator
make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 81: Missing dependency operator
make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 83: Need an operator
make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 261: Need an operator

make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 276: Need an operator

make: "/usr/home/openra/OpenRA/Makefile" line 378: Need an operator

make: stopped in /usr/home/openra/OpenRA
```

data.title: Dedicated requires libgdiplus
data.body:
That is a bug, as pointed out by @pchote on IRC.
See http://ix.io/iXm

data.title: Fix WithBuildingPlacedAnimation interrupting WithMakeAnimation
data.body:
The bug happens when a second (or third, fourth etc.) Conyard deploys while a building is placed from the first Conyard.

The `WithMakeAnimation` running on the second CY uses `Animation::PlayThen` to call `Building::Unlock` in a delegate.

`WithBuildingPlacedAnimation::BuildingPlaced` runs when a building placed and replaces the delegate from `WithMakeAnimation` with its own before it has a chance to run, and so the new Conyard never gets unlocked.

The fix is then to simply not run `BuildingPlaced` on conyards that haven't completed the make animation yet.

Fixes #8041.

data.title: Fixed an exploit where choosing another players color crashes the game
data.body: Fixes #8060 by simply not logging to which other player the color belonged. Obviously we can't use the duplicate player colors as keys for our dictionary. It also added extra bloat for a not very interesting information. This simplifies things and adds consistency towards the other checks.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in LobbyCommands.ValidateCommand
data.body: I believe this fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4720. It is either `client` or `server` which are null. As this happens on dedicated servers I assume `server` is not null. Also the `server.log` indicates clients dropping and the client state switching constantly which might race here.

data.title: Fixed EndOfStreamException in MixFile.ReadBlocks
data.body: Closes #5866 by replacing the EndOfStreamException with more useful ones for debugging like we do in StreamExts. I am not sure what is happening. It seems to be a Windows .NET only issue. Probably related to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2441.

data.title: Fixed NREs in LobbyCommands PingFromClient
data.body: Fixes #7515 as `PingFromClient` return `SingleOrDefault` so it can be null. Also added a missing `SyncClientPing()`. Discovered by my eye balls.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException at SpriteFont.Measure
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6813. Undetected by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed null reference exception when processing the Pause order
data.body: Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a null reference exception in Map.Save
data.body: Discovered via Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a dereference null return value in ZipFile.GetContent
data.body: I believe this could blow up easily which should be avoided. Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a resource leak in BigFile
data.body: This isn't used anywhere except @ScottNZ's abandoned CCG demake mod so not too severe. Still it is code that could serve as a template to others so it should dispose streams properly. Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Catched an explicit null dereference in PngLoader
data.body: `bitmap` stays null when `IHDR` is not parsed so I decided to throw because of invalid data here. Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Added a Coverity Scan Badge to the README file
data.body: It will show new defects introduced or stay green for status quo or improving code quality.
